learning_objectives.objective: Define session replay attack, session ID, session hijacking, Man-in-the-Middle (MitM), and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
Explain the mechanism of a session replay attack, including how session IDs are intercepted and replayed to impersonate users.
Demonstrate a session replay attack using tools like Burp Suite or Wireshark in a controlled lab environment.
Compare session replay attacks with other session hijacking methods (e.g., session fixation or prediction).
Critique the effectiveness of common session management practices (e.g., HttpOnly/Secure flags, TLS) against session replay attacks.
Design a comprehensive mitigation strategy for session replay attacks in a web application scenario, including policy recommendations and OWASP-compliant best practices.
